skill.author: AI-Vibe-Prompts

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only Git best practices guidance and workflow instructions for AI behavior.

content.value_statement: This skill ensures clean commit history and proper branch management by enforcing Conventional Commits and GitFlow patterns. Teams get consistent, readable git history that simplifies code reviews and debugging.
actual_capabilities: Generate commit messages following Conventional Commits format
Apply GitFlow branch naming conventions automatically
Guide pull request creation and code review workflows
Provide pre-commit checklist for secret detection
limitations: Does not execute git commands directly
Requires user to run git commands manually

use_cases.title: Write clear commit messages
use_cases.description: Generate standardized commit messages that make project history easy to understand

use_cases.title: Enforce team conventions
use_cases.description: Ensure all team members follow consistent branch naming and commit message formats

use_cases.title: Standardize release workflows
use_cases.description: Apply GitFlow patterns for release branches and hotfix management

prompt_templates.title: Create a commit
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a conventional commit message for these changes. Use the format: type(scope): description

prompt_templates.title: Start a feature branch
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GitFlow-style branch name for this feature. Include ticket ID if available.

prompt_templates.title: Review before merge
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my git diff for secrets and run the pre-commit quality checklist.

prompt_templates.title: Plan release branches
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply GitFlow patterns to create release and hotfix branches with proper naming.

best_practices: Use conventional commit format with type, scope, and description
Name branches with type, ticket ID, and short description
Always run pre-commit secret detection before staging
Follow GitFlow: feature branches merge to develop, hotfixes merge to main
anti_patterns: Using generic commit messages like 'fixed bug' or 'update'
Creating branches without ticket references or clear naming
Skipping pre-commit quality checks before committing
Merging feature branches directly to main branch

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill supports Claude, Claude Code, and GitHub Codex. It auto-invokes when git-related keywords are detected.

faq.question: What commit types are supported?
faq.answer: Supported types are: feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, perf, test, chore, and ci.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance templates. You apply the patterns manually or configure your git client to use these conventions.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill that provides guidance. It never accesses or stores your repository data.

faq.question: Why are my commits not being generated?
faq.answer: The skill provides templates and guidance. You must run git commands manually. Check that your prompt mentions git terms to trigger auto-invocation.

faq.question: How does this compare to git hooks?
faq.answer: Git hooks run automatically on your machine. This skill provides AI-guided git patterns you apply manually. Use both together for best results.
